1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
3
4module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Cox.Calc
5  ( ropsCoxCalc,
6  
7    -- * add
8    consAdd, relmapAdd,
9  
10    -- * subst
11    consSubst, relmapSubst,
12  
13    -- * fill
14    consFill, relmapFill,
15  
16    -- * replace
17    consReplace,
18  
19    -- * replace-all
20    consReplaceAll, relmapReplaceAll,
21  
22    -- * split
23    consSplit, relmapSplit, relkitSplit,
24  
25    -- * unary
26    consUnary, relmapUnary,
27  ) where
28
29import Prelude hiding (getContents)
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base            as B
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax          as S
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data            as D
33import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core            as C
34import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base        as Op
35import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Cox.Get     as Op
36import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Cox.Message as Msg
37
38
39-- | Implementation of relational operators.
40--
41--   [@add \/N E ...@]
42--     Add terms of name @\/N@ and content @E@ ...
43-- 
44ropsCoxCalc :: (D.CContent c) => [C.Rop c]
45ropsCoxCalc = Op.ropList "cox-calc"
46    --        CONSTRUCTOR       USAGE                          ATTRIBUTE
47    [ Op.def  consAdd           "add /N E ..."                 "-cox* . -where?"
48    , Op.def  consFill          "fill /P ... -with E"          "-term* . -with"
49    , Op.def  consReplace       "replace /P ... -by F"         "-term* . -by"
50    , Op.def  consReplaceAll    "replace-all -from E -to E"    ". -from -to"
51    , Op.def  consSplit         "split /N E ..."               "-cox* . -where?"
52    , Op.def  consSubst         "subst /N E ..."               "-cox* . -where?"
53    , Op.def  consUnary         "unary /N E ..."               "-term -expr*"
54    , Op.def  consDumpCox       "dump-cox E"                   "-cox*"
55    ]
56
57
58-- ----------------------  add
59
60consAdd :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
61consAdd med =
62    do cops <- Op.getWhere med "-where"
63       cox <- Op.getTermCoxes med "-cox"
64       Right $ relmapAdd med (cops, cox)
65
66relmapAdd :: (D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> (D.CopSet c, [D.NamedCox c]) -> C.Relmap c
67relmapAdd med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitAdd
68
69relkitAdd :: (D.CContent c) => (D.CopSet c, [D.NamedCox c]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
70relkitAdd _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
71relkitAdd (cops, cox) (Just he1)
72    | null ind  = Right kit2
73    | otherwise = Msg.reqNewTerm ns he1
74    where
75      (ns, xs)    =  unzip cox               -- names and expressions
76      ns1         =  D.getTermNames he1      -- term names of input relation
77      ind         =  ns `B.snipIndex` ns1    -- indicies for ns on input relation
78      he2         =  ns `D.headAppend` he1
79      kit2        =  C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToAbOne False kitf2 []
80      kitf2 _ cs1 =  do cs2 <- D.coxRunCox cops he1 cs1 `mapM` xs
81                        Right $ cs2 ++ cs1
82
83
84-- ----------------------  subst
85
86consSubst :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
87consSubst med =
88    do cops <- Op.getWhere med "-where"
89       cox <- Op.getTermCoxes med "-cox"
90       Right $ relmapSubst med (cops, cox)
91
92relmapSubst :: (D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> (D.CopSet c, [D.NamedCox c]) -> C.Relmap c
93relmapSubst med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitSubst
94
95relkitSubst :: (D.CContent c) => (D.CopSet c, [D.NamedCox c]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
96relkitSubst _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
97relkitSubst (cops, cox) (Just he1)
98    | B.sameLength ns ind = Right kit2
99    | otherwise           = Msg.unexpTermName
100    where
101      (ns, xs)  =  unzip cox               -- names and expressions
102      ns1       =  D.getTermNames he1      -- term names of input relation
103      ind       =  ns `B.snipIndex` ns1    -- indicies for ns on input relation
104      cut       =  B.snipOff  ind          -- cutting-ns function
105      fore      =  B.snipForward ind       -- cutting-ns function
106      he2       =  D.headMap fore he1      -- heading of output relation
107      kit2      =  C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToAbOne True f2 []
108      f2 _ cs1  =  do cs2 <- D.coxRunCox cops he1 cs1 `mapM` xs
109                      Right $ cs2 ++ cut cs1
110
111
112-- ----------------------  fill
113
114--    > fill /a /b -with 0
115
116consFill :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
117consFill med =
118  do ns    <- Op.getTerms med "-term"
119     coxTo <- Op.getCox med "-with"
120     let cops = C.globalCopset $ C.ropGlobal med
121     Right $ relmapFill med (ns, cops, coxTo)
122
123relmapFill :: (D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> ([S.TermName], D.CopSet c, D.Cox c) -> C.Relmap c
124relmapFill med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitFill
125
126relkitFill :: (D.CContent c) => ([S.TermName], D.CopSet c, D.Cox c) -> C.RelkitFlow c
127relkitFill _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
128relkitFill (ns, cops, coxTo) (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
129    ns1       =  D.getTermNames he1
130    ind       =  ns `B.snipIndex` ns1
131    pick      =  B.snipFrom ind
132    cut       =  B.snipOff  ind
133    fore      =  B.snipForward ind
134    he2       =  D.headMap fore he1
135    kit2      =  C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToAbOne True f2 []
136    f2 _ cs1  =  do cTo  <- D.coxRunCox cops he1 cs1 coxTo
137                    let fill c | D.isEmpty c = cTo
138                               | otherwise   = c
139                    Right $ map fill (pick cs1) ++ (cut cs1)
140
141
142-- ----------------------  replace
143
144--    > replace /a /b -by (| x | if x < 0 -> 0 : x |)
145
146consReplace :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
147consReplace med =
148    do ns     <- Op.getTerms med "-term"
149       coxBy  <- Op.getCox med "-by"
150       B.unless (D.coxSyntacticArity coxBy == 1) $ do
151         B.abortable "relmap-replace" [coxBy] Msg.reqUnaryFn
152       let expr n = (n, D.CoxFill [] coxBy [D.CoxTerm [] [n] []])
153           cops   = C.globalCopset $ C.ropGlobal med
154       Right $ relmapSubst med (cops, map expr ns)
155
156
157-- ----------------------  replace-all
158
159--    > replace-all -from () -to 0
160
161consReplaceAll :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
162consReplaceAll med =
163  do coxFrom <- Op.getCox med "-from"
164     coxTo   <- Op.getCox med "-to"
165     let cops = C.globalCopset $ C.ropGlobal med
166     Right $ relmapReplaceAll med (cops, coxFrom, coxTo)
167
168relmapReplaceAll :: (D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> (D.CopSet c, D.Cox c, D.Cox c) -> C.Relmap c
169relmapReplaceAll med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitReplaceAll
170
171relkitReplaceAll :: (D.CContent c) => (D.CopSet c, D.Cox c, D.Cox c) -> C.RelkitFlow c
172relkitReplaceAll _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
173relkitReplaceAll (cops, coxFrom, coxTo) (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
174    kit2     = C.relkitJust he1 $ C.RelkitOneToAbOne False f2 []
175    f2 _ cs  = do cFrom    <-  D.coxRunCox cops he1 cs coxFrom
176                  cTo      <-  D.coxRunCox cops he1 cs coxTo
177                  let replace c | c == cFrom = cTo
178                                | otherwise  = c
179                  Right $ map replace cs
180
181
182-- ----------------------  split
183
184consSplit :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
185consSplit med =
186    do cops <- Op.getWhere med "-where"
187       cox <- Op.getTermCoxes med "-cox"
188       Right $ relmapSplit med (cops, cox)
189
190relmapSplit :: (D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> (D.CopSet c, [D.NamedCox c]) -> C.Relmap c
191relmapSplit med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitSplit
192
193relkitSplit :: forall c. (D.CContent c) => (D.CopSet c, [D.NamedCox c]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
194relkitSplit _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
195relkitSplit (cops, cox) (Just he1)
196    | null ind  = Right kit2
197    | otherwise = Msg.unexpTermName
198    where
199      (ns, xs)    =  unzip cox               -- names and expressions
200      ns1         =  D.getTermNames he1      -- term names
201      ind         =  ns `B.snipIndex` ns1    -- shared indicies
202
203      he2         =  D.headNests ns he1
204      kit2        =  C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitAbFull False kitf2 []
205      kitf2 _ bo1 =  do let fs2 = D.coxRunList cops he1 `map` xs
206                        cs2 <- split fs2 bo1
207                        Right [cs2]
208
209      split :: [D.RunList c] -> [[c]] -> B.Ab [c]
210      split [] _ = Right []
211      split (f : fs2) bo1 =
212          do bo2 <- run f `mapM` bo1
213             let first = filter fst bo2
214                 rest  = map snd $ B.omit fst bo2
215             rest' <- split fs2 rest
216             let rel = D.Rel he1 $ map snd first
217             Right $ D.pRel rel : rest'
218
219      run :: D.RunList c -> [c] -> B.Ab (Bool, [c])
220      run f cs = do c <- f cs
221                    case D.isBool c of
222                      True  -> Right (D.gBool c, cs)
223                      False -> Msg.reqBool
224
225
226-- ----------------------  unary
227
228--  > unary /n 1 : 2 : 3
229
230consUnary :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
231consUnary med =
232    do n  <- Op.getTerm  med "-term"
233       cs <- Op.getContents med "-expr"
234       Right $ relmapUnary med (n, cs)
235
236relmapUnary :: (D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> (S.TermName, [c]) -> C.Relmap c
237relmapUnary med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitUnary
238
239relkitUnary :: (D.CContent c) => (S.TermName, [c]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
240relkitUnary (n, cs) _ = Right kit2 where
241    he2    = D.headFrom [n]
242    kit2   = C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitAbFull True f2 []
243    f2 _ _ = Right $ map B.li1 cs
244
245
246
247-- ----------------------  dump-cox
248
249--  > dump-cox /x >= 0
250
251consDumpCox :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
252consDumpCox med =
253    do cox <- Op.getCox med "-cox"
254       Msg.dumpCox cox
255
